extension.description: Switch between multiple Git identities. Manage multiple GitHub accounts, SSH keys, GPG signing, and automatically apply identity to Git Submodules.
config.title: Git ID Switcher
config.identities: List of Git identities to switch between
config.identities.markdown:
List of Git identities. Each identity can have:
- `id`: Unique identifier (required)
- `name`: Git user.name (required)
- `email`: Git user.email (required)
- `icon`: Emoji to display in status bar
- `description`: Short description of this identity
- `sshKeyPath`: Path to SSH private key
- `sshHost`: SSH config host alias (for multi-account setups)
- `gpgKeyId`: GPG key ID for commit signing
config.identities.icon: Icon/emoji to display in status bar
config.identities.name: Git user.name
config.identities.description: Short description of this identity (shown in quick pick and tooltip)
config.identities.sshHost: SSH config host alias for multi-account setups (optional)
config.identities.gpgKeyId: GPG key ID for commit signing (optional)
config.defaultIdentity: Default identity ID to use when no identity is selected
config.autoSwitchSshKey: Automatically switch SSH key when changing identities
config.applyToSubmodules: Automatically apply identity to Git submodules when switching
config.submoduleDepth: Maximum depth for nested submodule configuration (1 = direct submodules only)
